com.avaya.csta.binding

Class ToneRetrievalCriteria

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
      • com.avaya.csta.binding.ToneRetrievalCriteria
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ToneRetrievalCriteria
extends ch.ecma.csta.CastorObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Used to specify the criteria to retrieve tones from the buffer.

    Each time a tone is detected, it is put in the buffer and the tones in the buffer are checked to see if the retrieval criteria are met. If one of the retrieval criteria is met, a tones retrieved event is generated and the criteria are cleared. The connector server continues buffering detected tones.

    Tones in the buffer can be retrieved based on one or more of these criteria:

    • when a specified flush character is detected - Achieve this by setting the flushCharacter in ToneRetrievalCriteria request. The flush character is included in the string of tones retrieved.
    • when a specified number of tones has been collected - Achieve this by setting the numberOfTones in ToneRetrievalCriteria request.
    • when the specifed time in milliseconds has elapsed - Achieve this by setting the initialTimeout ane interdigitTimeout in ToneRetrievalCriteria request.
    At least one of the retrieval criteria must be set and if you want set timeout, initialTimeout and interdigitTimeout both should be set. The first one to occur causes the bufferd tones to be retrieved.

    The ToneRetrievalCriteria request has these parameters:

    ToneRetrievalCriteria Request Parameters
    object Mandatory Specifies the device within a connection ID or not. See Setting a Connection ID for a coding example of how to set just the device ID portion of a ConnectionID. Use object.setCall(connection) before calling request.setObject(object). Or choose to use object.setDevice(DeviceID)before calling request.setObject(object).
    numberOfTones Optional Criteria specifying the number of tones to collect before reporting them to the application.
    flushCharacter Optional Criteria specifying a flush character to listen for before reporting collected tones to the application. Flush character can be one of the digits "0" to "9" or "*" or "#".
    initialTimeout Optional Criteria specifying the time in milliseconds when the retrieval criteria are set until the first digit is detected.
    interdigitTimeout Optional Criteria specifying the time in milliseconds between successive digits. The timer starts after each digit is detected or from the start of the retrieval if digits are already in the buffer when the criteria are set.
    extensions Not supported

    Negative Acknowledgements:

    • operation:invalidParameterValue - Sent if request is null, or no retrieval criterion is set, or neither initialTimeout nor interdigitTimeout are not in the request, or numberOfTones or initialTimeout or interdigitTimeout is less than or equal to zero.
    • operation:invalidConnectionID - Sent if the ConnectionID/DeviceID of this request is null.
    • unspecified - Sent if an implementation-specific error occurs.
    Version:
    $Revision$ $Date$
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
